content:
• Tuesday, March 27, 2012
  • TMP

    Tompkins Financial (NYSEMKT:TMP) announces a $30M secondary offering. Macquarie Capital and...

    Tompkins Financial (NYSEMKT:TMP) announces a $30M secondary offering. Macquarie Capital and Keefe, Bruyette & Woods will act as joint book-running managers for the sale. Shares -1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM
  • EXFO

    More on EXFO Electo-Optical (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ2 misses across the board on weak revenue. Net...

    More on EXFO Electo-Optical (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ2 misses across the board on weak revenue. Net earnings fell 39% as profit slipped on a decline in bookings, though margins improved. The company also guides FQ3 lower, now expecting to earn $0.01 - $0.05 per share on revenue of $68M. Street estimates are at $0.10 per share on $72M in revenue. Shares -5.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 PM
  • NLST

    Netlist (OTC:NLST) says the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office issued two favorable Office Actions...

    Netlist (OTC:NLST) says the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office issued two favorable Office Actions in the reexaminations of a number of the company's patents, allowing all claims. The patents were being challenged over cited art that was claimed to be protected by Inphi Corporation. Shares +6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:32 PM
  • CAST

    ChincaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST) +3% AH after announcing CFO Antonio Sena has stepped down, and...

    ChincaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST) +3% AH after announcing CFO Antonio Sena has stepped down, and board member Doug Woodrum will be serving as interim CFO. ChinaCast, which has been dogged by fraud allegations and internal strife, also says it's initiating a search for a permanent CEO and CFO.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • RBN

    Robbins & Myers (NYSE:RBN): FQ2 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $256M (+39.2% Y/Y)...

    Robbins & Myers (NYSE:RBN): FQ2 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $256M (+39.2% Y/Y) beats by $18M. Shares +7.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • OCLR

    Citi praises Oclaro's (OCLR -6.4%) purchase of Opnext (OPXT +53.1%) for having minimal product...

    Citi praises Oclaro's (OCLR -6.4%) purchase of Opnext (OPXT +53.1%) for having minimal product overlap, and reducing Oclaro's telecom industry exposure. It also thinks a target for $35M-$45M in annual cost savings is reasonable. Credit Suisse notes Opnext is being acquired at just a 0.32x enterprise value/sales multiple, and expects the deal to be a positive for optical component peers such as JDSU and FNSR. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • CDXS

    Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS) has been awarded a patent from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office...

    Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS) has been awarded a patent from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office covering its proprietary enzymatic technology, which can be used for production of cellulosic biofuels. Shares +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • SNX

    More on Synnex's (NYSE:SNX) FQ1: Gross margin was 6.8%, up 100 bps Y/Y. The revenue miss is...

    More on Synnex's (NYSE:SNX) FQ1: Gross margin was 6.8%, up 100 bps Y/Y. The revenue miss is blamed on a transition to a "fee-for-service logistics relationship"  for part of the company's Distribution services business. Synnex expects FQ2 revenue of $2.45B-$2.55B and EPS of $0.87-$0.91, below Street estimates of $2.6B and $0.95.  SNX -6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • OXM

    Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM): Q4 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $199.7M (+26.6% Y/Y)...

    Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM): Q4 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $199.7M (+26.6% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • EXFO

    EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ2 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.06. Revenue of...

    EXFO Electro-Optical Engineering (NASDAQ:EXFO): FQ2 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $66.9M (-7.1% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -6.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • KIOR

    Cowen says KiOR's (KIOR +7%) Q4 results were in-line with expectations, but it still sees upside...

    Cowen says KiOR's (KIOR +7%) Q4 results were in-line with expectations, but it still sees upside to the shares. Cowen cites the construction of its first plant ahead of schedule and a second site already planned, and improved R&D in several areas pointing to long-term improvement on yield expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • SNX

    Synnex (NYSE:SNX): FQ1 EPS of $1.02 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $2.46B (-1.6% Y/Y) misses by...

    Synnex (NYSE:SNX): FQ1 EPS of $1.02 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $2.46B (-1.6% Y/Y) misses by $90M. Shares -4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +4.4%) rallied strongly today before giving up some of its gains into the close. A...

    Sina (SINA +4.4%) rallied strongly today before giving up some of its gains into the close. A possible trigger is a deal with white-hot mobile news startup Flipboard to integrate Weibo content in a manner similar to Twitter. Flipboard, which just launched a Chinese iPhone app to go with its iPad offering, says it's looking have 5M Chinese users by year's end.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • MU

    Jefferies initiates coverage of Micron (MU +4.4%) at Buy and SanDisk (SNDK -0.5%) at Hold,...

    Jefferies initiates coverage of Micron (MU +4.4%) at Buy and SanDisk (SNDK -0.5%) at Hold, writing that both NAND and DRAM chips will benefit from a “benign” supply situation and the build-out of cloud computing facilities and the consequent adoption of SSDs. While SNDK is “undoubtedly the leader in NAND,” MU produces DRAM and NOR memory chips, not just NAND.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • JBLU

    JetBlue (JBLU -2%) says a flight from Kennedy Airport to Las Vegas was forced to make an...

    JetBlue (JBLU -2%) says a flight from Kennedy Airport to Las Vegas was forced to make an emergency landing in Texas after one of its pilots erupted into a screaming fit. The captain had what the company called a “medical situation” and was reportedly screaming and acting wildly before being subdued by passengers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 4 Comments
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +10.9%) shares resume trading, popping more than 10% after the company...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +10.9%) shares resume trading, popping more than 10% after the company confirms the FDA cleared the company's peginesatide anemia treatment for patients on dialysis for chronic kidney disease. The drug will be AFFY's first marketed product. Competitor Amgen (AMGN +0.5%) also trades higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • TM

    Toyota (TM +1.7%) is expected to unveil an all-new car next week to replace the full-sized...

    Toyota (TM +1.7%) is expected to unveil an all-new car next week to replace the full-sized Avalon. Dealers who saw a preview of the vehicle last year say the new sedan represents a dramatic styling change for the brand.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • YELP

    Shares of Yelp (YELP +9.1%) catch fire and carve out an alltime high in the process. The closest...

    Shares of Yelp (YELP +9.1%) catch fire and carve out an alltime high in the process. The closest thing resembling a kickstarter is word that the company will offer a new tool on its website that allows customers to improve their ability to measure metrics.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings (SHLD +2.8%) marketing chief Monica Woo resigns after only five months on the...

    Sears Holdings (SHLD +2.8%) marketing chief Monica Woo resigns after only five months on the job, joining a host of other execs who have bailed out on the company in 2012. Despite the seemingly endless string of bad news for the company, shares are up +131.6% YTD - leading Joseph Aguirre to make a case that hedge funds are manipulating the action.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 6 Comments
  • AUDC

    AudioCodes (AUDC -5%) slips after Chardan downgraded the shares earlier today, citing...

    AudioCodes (AUDC -5%) slips after Chardan downgraded the shares earlier today, citing disappointing guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • MCK

    McKesson (MCK +1%) moves up after Baird raises its price target on the shares to $99 from $96....

    McKesson (MCK +1%) moves up after Baird raises its price target on the shares to $99 from $96. Baird made the change to include its recent acquisition of the Katz Group, noting the company's valuation and positive synergies stemming from the deal. Goldman also raises its FY13 estimates 6% above the Street consensus on the buyout.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • DDC

    Harry Winston (HWD -5.6%) dips after BMO cut the shares to Market Perform on valuation, citing...

    Harry Winston (HWD -5.6%) dips after BMO cut the shares to Market Perform on valuation, citing its less than stellar Rio Diamond review.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • EPAM

    Eastern European outsourcing firm EPAM Systems (EPAM +12.8%) skyrockets after reporting Q4...

    Eastern European outsourcing firm EPAM Systems (EPAM +12.8%) skyrockets after reporting Q4 revenue of $95.1M (+34% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.30, beating consensus by $5.8M and $0.02. EPAM is also guiding for Q1 revenue of $92M-$94M and EPS of $0.28-$0.30 (consensus is for $91.6M and $0.22), and 2012 revenue of $411M-$418M (consensus is for $408.6M). EPAM went public last month, and received favorable coverage last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • SCHL

    Scholastic (SCHL -1.1%) falls back a bit from a runup in its share price tied to the success of...

    Scholastic (SCHL -1.1%) falls back a bit from a runup in its share price tied to the success of The Hunger Games. Weighing on the company today is the news that all 7 Harry Potter books are now available on Amazon Kindles, with author J.K. Rowling holding the digital rights.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S -1.8%) loses ground after CFO Joseph Euteneuer says at a Barclays conference (webcast)...

    Sprint (S -1.8%) loses ground after CFO Joseph Euteneuer says at a Barclays conference (webcast) his company is looking to buy more spectrum, and that the wireless industry should see more consolidation, albeit while adding Sprint currently doesn't have the "currency" for a deal. Sprint's aborted attempt to acquire MetroPCS (PCS -4.1%) last month wasn't well-received by the Street.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • KBR

    KBR (KBR -3%) slides after Lazard cut the shares to Neutral earlier today due to lack of drivers...

    KBR (KBR -3%) slides after Lazard cut the shares to Neutral earlier today due to lack of drivers to support 2012 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • HTS

    Hatteras Financial (HTS -2.4%) falls to $27.37 in the wake of its stock offering, which the...

    Hatteras Financial (HTS -2.4%) falls to $27.37 in the wake of its stock offering, which the company ultimately increased to 17.5M shares, and appears to have priced around $27.12. Nonetheless, Sterne Agee is responding by upgrading Hatteras to Buy, arguing the offering, whose proceeds Hatteras will use to buy MBS, will boost its book value and net interest rate spreads, and will likely see high demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • AEO

    American Eagle (AEO +0.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Lazard Capital, noting the...

    American Eagle (AEO +0.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy at Lazard Capital, noting the retailer's recovering earnings power and improving clothing selections.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • CROX

    Shares of Crocs (CROX +1.1%) trade higher after Wedbush initiates coverage on the company with...

    Shares of Crocs (CROX +1.1%) trade higher after Wedbush initiates coverage on the company with an Outperform rating and $25 price target. Analyst Corrina Freedman sees positive revenue drivers for Crocs and finds its valuation attractive relative to growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • APOL

    Apollo Group (APOL -8.4%) is the S&P's worst performer, as the largest for-profit education...

    Apollo Group (APOL -8.4%) is the S&P's worst performer, as the largest for-profit education provider's H1 2012 revenues were hurt by a 15.6% Y/Y drop in enrollments at its flagship U. of Phoenix. Citigroup and Credit Suisse question APOL’s ability to meet earnings targets as future enrollment rates are predicted to be "volatile." ESI-OLD -3.7%, STRA -2.9%, CECO -6.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +0.9%) ticks up after Lazard Capital pounds the table on the stock, calling...

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +0.9%) ticks up after Lazard Capital pounds the table on the stock, calling it the best growth story in the gaming group and reiterating a Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • DK

    Delek (DK +2.9%) moves up on an upgrade to Overweight at Barclays, citing increased marketing...

    Delek (DK +2.9%) moves up on an upgrade to Overweight at Barclays, citing increased marketing and supply segment value plus an improved refining earnings outlook. The firm also raises its price target to $18 from $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • REVUQ

    Princeton Review (REVU +5.8%) will sell its test-preparation business and the "Princeton Review"...

    Princeton Review (REVU +5.8%) will sell its test-preparation business and the "Princeton Review" brand to PE firm Charlesbank Capital Partners for $33M in cash, choosing to sharpen its focus toward online education services. The company will cease to be known as Princeton Review and become a to-be-named holding company for the online Penn Foster business.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +1.4%) moves up after Roth Capital ups its price target on the shares to $42...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +1.4%) moves up after Roth Capital ups its price target on the shares to $42 from $21. Roth thinks the market potential for the drug developer's lymphoma treatment ibrutinib is quite large, and it's impressed by the speed of the clinical program for the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR -3.2%) adds to losses a day after detailing plans to shed its oil and gas...

    Nabors Industries (NBR -3.2%) adds to losses a day after detailing plans to shed its oil and gas properties and other non-core businesses. NBR says it hopes to raise at least $800M selling energy fields in Texas, Canada, Alaska and Colombia as well as an Alaskan oilfield service business, three Canadian service units and 18 shallow-water rigs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • AFFY

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +4.4%) are halted after sources report that the FDA has approved the...

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +4.4%) are halted after sources report that the FDA has approved the company's anemia drug. (Earlier: AFFY's roller coaster ride)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM

  • Along with TVIX is the evisceration of another ETN that traded far above its NAV. Supposedly set...

    Along with TVIX is the evisceration of another ETN that traded far above its NAV. Supposedly set up to track the returns of natural gas, GAZ, -4.8% today and 47% over 6+ sessions, as it erases a premium of more than 100% of NAV. "Everyone's late on the first trade, but are starting to look for what else is out there that could be dangerous," says Peter Tchir.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • ON

    FBR Capital reiterates an Outperform rating and $18 price target on Fairchild Semiconductor (FCS...

    FBR Capital reiterates an Outperform rating and $18 price target on Fairchild Semiconductor (FCS +2.5%), believing the company will get a boost from the cyclical recovery in semiconductors, and that Apple is becoming a more important part of its total revenue stream - “another positive as Fairchild is increasingly viewed as a smartphone play."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM

  • Crude oil dives $1 in minutes after an unnamed official hits the tape suggesting the U.S. is...

    Crude oil dives $1 in minutes after an unnamed official hits the tape suggesting the U.S. is still considering a release from the SPR. WTI crude -0.3% at $106.72.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 7 Comments
  • LMT

    Lockheed Martin (LMT +0.4%) bucks a weak tape after saying it's submitted a proposal for a...

    Lockheed Martin (LMT +0.4%) bucks a weak tape after saying it's submitted a proposal for a substantially lighter and more affordable Joint Light Tactical Vehicle for the next phase of the U.S. Army and Marine Corps competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE -2.4%) sells off after striking a deal to acquire VIA Travel, a Scandinavian...

    Expedia (EXPE -2.4%) sells off after striking a deal to acquire VIA Travel, a Scandinavian corporate travel management company, for an undisclosed sum. The deal comes as larger rival Priceline (PCLN) continues to gain European share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • ARNA

    Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +11.9%) are back at it again today after knocking out a...

    Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +11.9%) are back at it again today after knocking out a big gain yesterday off of regulatory success both in the U.S. and across the pond. The two-day rally has pushed Arena's share price past a 52-week high.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • AA

    Stifel Nicolaus ups its price target on Alcoa (AA +6.3%) to $13 from $11, saying the company's...

    Stifel Nicolaus ups its price target on Alcoa (AA +6.3%) to $13 from $11, saying the company's Engineered Products and Solutions business segment deserves a higher multiple, in light of peer valuations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • ASNA

    Shares of Charming Shoppes (CHRS -4.4%) trade lower following the firm's FQ4 earnings report...

    Shares of Charming Shoppes (CHRS -4.4%) trade lower following the firm's FQ4 earnings report which included the disclosure that it plans to close 90-105 underperforming stores in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • TOT

    A Total (TOT -6.3%) senior manager says the firm is looking at two main options to try to stop...

    A Total (TOT -6.3%) senior manager says the firm is looking at two main options to try to stop the North Sea gas leak at its abandoned Elgin platform: drilling a relief well, which could take six months, or the faster but riskier alternative of sending in engineers to "kill" the leak. TOT owns ~36% and Italy's ENI (E -2%) has 22% of Elgin, which accounts for 3% of U.K. natural gas output and 5.5% of oil production.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • LEN

    Homebuilders are up nicely following Lennar's (LEN +3.1%) FQ1 earnings beat and its statement...

    Homebuilders are up nicely following Lennar's (LEN +3.1%) FQ1 earnings beat and its statement that the market is stabilizing due to low house prices and interest rates. PulteGroup (NYSE:PHM) +4.1%, Ryland (NYSE:RYL) +3.75%, DR Horton (NYSE:DHI) +3.7%, and KB Home (NYSE:KBH), which reported weak results on Friday, +2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • AFFY

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY -9.1%) become unhinged with a sudden 17% nosedive before they track...

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY -9.1%) become unhinged with a sudden 17% nosedive before they track back up again. Much of the speculation over the company has centered on whether its anemia drug Peginesatide will land FDA approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • SKX

    Shares of Skechers (SKX -4.3%) trade lower after Wedbush initiates coverage on the company with...

    Shares of Skechers (SKX -4.3%) trade lower after Wedbush initiates coverage on the company with a dour Underperform rating. The Street isn't overly optimistic about the stock with only 1 rating out of 7 on the books above a Hold.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • RCII

    Rent-A-Center (RCII +4.4%) jumps higher this morning on an upgrade to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus....

    Rent-A-Center (RCII +4.4%) jumps higher this morning on an upgrade to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus. The firm cites stabilization in its core business and faster roll out of RAC acceptance kiosks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • PFE

    Pfizer's (PFE +2.4%) Ian Read is open to further separations beyond the animal health and infant...

    Pfizer's (PFE +2.4%) Ian Read is open to further separations beyond the animal health and infant nutrition segments if conditions make sense, Goldman Sachs says after meeting with the CEO. While the firm expects no PE arbitrage now to warrant a separation of the pharma and generics businesses, it sees the potential for such a scenario if PFE's pipeline proves successful.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • NES

    Heckmann (HEK -2.1%) prices its public offering of 18.2M shares at $4.40 a pop, with proceeds...

    Heckmann (HEK -2.1%) prices its public offering of 18.2M shares at $4.40 a pop, with proceeds from the sale earmarked to help the company pay for its acquisition of TFI Holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +7.3%) leads rare earth producers sharply higher, perhaps fueled by a 363% Y/Y...

    Molycorp (MCP +7.3%) leads rare earth producers sharply higher, perhaps fueled by a 363% Y/Y profit gain reported overnight by Baotou Steel Rare Earth (which closed 8.4% higher in Shanghai). Still, the company says retreating rare earth prices from last year's H2 show no signs of rebounding.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • WNC

    Semi-trailer maker Wabash National (WNC +12.5%) agrees to buy privately-held Walker Group...

    Semi-trailer maker Wabash National (WNC +12.5%) agrees to buy privately-held Walker Group Holdings, a maker of liquid-transportation systems and engineered products, for $360M in cash to diversify its business. The acquisition would immediately add to earnings, WNC says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) -13.2% after its Davy Jones update. MMR was forced to "move up...

    McMoRan Exploration (NYSE:MMR) -13.2% after its Davy Jones update. MMR was forced to "move up the hole" after a perforating gun malfunctioned, which Jefferies says, "highlights once again the engineering risks of the ultra-deep play." Firm adds: "We continue to see more attractive risk/reward elsewhere in our coverage universe."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • REX

    CapitalOne upgrades REX Energy (REX +2.3%) to Add from Neutral on a valuation call and adds a...

    CapitalOne upgrades REX Energy (REX +2.3%) to Add from Neutral on a valuation call and adds a dollar to its price target on the company to take it to $14. Shares -27.6% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • OPXT

    Up initially following its all-stock acquisition of Opnext (OPXT +47.8%), Oclaro (OCLR -7.1%) is...

    Up initially following its all-stock acquisition of Opnext (OPXT +47.8%), Oclaro (OCLR -7.1%) is now lower. Concerns about the deal's premium, and perhaps the potential for share loss as customers strive to keep a diverse stable of suppliers, could be having an impact. That, in turn, has brought Opnext shares down to $1.67, well below the $1.96 price implied by yesterday's close. Rivals are trading higher: FNSR +3.4%. JDSU +2.2%. NPTN +1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • SWY

    Safeway (NYSE:SWY) releases detailed information on its pension underfunding, pegging the number...

    Safeway (NYSE:SWY) releases detailed information on its pension underfunding, pegging the number at $1.88B after Credit Suisse warned clients yesterday that it tabulated a $7B shortfall. Shares +2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • OPXT

    Premarket gainers: OPXT +55%. WNC +9%. ISTA +8%. DANG +5%. RBS +3%. ARNA +3%. LEN +3%.Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: OPXT +55%. WNC +9%. ISTA +8%. DANG +5%. RBS +3%. ARNA +3%. LEN +3%.
    Losers: MAPP -17%. MMR -16%. APOL -6%. NBG -6%. TOT -6%. OCLR -3%. EXPE -3%. HEK -3%. EXXI -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • NEOG

    Neogen (NASDAQ:NEOG): FQ3 EPS of $0.22 in-line. Revenue of $44.9M (+6.4% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M....

    Neogen (NASDAQ:NEOG): FQ3 EPS of $0.22 in-line. Revenue of $44.9M (+6.4% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M. Shares -1.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • CRWS

    Crown Crafts (NASDAQ:CRWS) +19.5% premarket after the supplier of infant accessories announces...

    Crown Crafts (NASDAQ:CRWS) +19.5% premarket after the supplier of infant accessories announces its board approved a doubling of its quarterly dividend to $0.08/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • DANG

    Dangdang (NYSE:DANG) +5.1% premarket after shares are upgraded to Outperform at Oppenheimer with...

    Dangdang (NYSE:DANG) +5.1% premarket after shares are upgraded to Outperform at Oppenheimer with a $9.50 target price. The firm says given DANG's market leadership in China's fast-growing B2C e-commerce space, early signs of a stabilizing operating and competitive environment and the return of investor interest in Chinese internet stocks, it is more positive on DANG's prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) +1.2% premarket after UBS upgrades shares to Buy with a $36 price...

    Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) +1.2% premarket after UBS upgrades shares to Buy with a $36 price target, up from $30. Analysts cite WMB's earnings boost from the planned $2.5B acquisition of Caiman Eastern Midstream by 72%-owned Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ), which will position WMB as "one of the top players in the Marcellus and Utica shales."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • MAPP

    JPMorgan tries to make sense out of all the drama with MAP Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MAPP), by...

    JPMorgan tries to make sense out of all the drama with MAP Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MAPP), by taking the long view that Levadex is an "attractive, approvable product" despite missing out on first-pass FDA approval.
